name: frege122d
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0
body: |- wi(w0, wo(wbr(c0, cfv(ctcl, c1), c2), wceq(c0, c2)))

stmt.origin: olcd(w0, wbr(c0, cfv(ctcl, c1), c2), wceq(c0, c2))

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wo(wbr(c0, cfv(ctcl, c1), c2), wceq(c0, c2)))
-| wi(w0, wceq(c0, c2))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wo(wbr(c0, cfv(ctcl, c1), c2), wceq(c0, c2)))
-| wi(w0, wceq(c0, c2))

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wceq(c0, c2))
-| wi(w0, wceq(c0, cfv(c1, c3)))
-| wi(w0, wceq(c2, cfv(c1, c3)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wo(wbr(c0, cfv(ctcl, c1), c2), wceq(c0, c2)))
-| wi(w0, wceq(c0, cfv(c1, c3)))
-| wi(w0, wceq(c2, cfv(c1, c3)))

comment: If ` F ` is a function, ` A ` is the successor of ` X ` , and ` B ` is the successor of ` X ` , then ` A ` and ` B ` are the same (or ` B ` follows ` A ` in the transitive closure of ` F ` ). Similar to Proposition 122 of [Frege1879] p. 79. Compare with ~ frege122 . (Contributed by RP, 15-Jul-2020.)
